story.text: (Updates with reaction to ISM data)NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - The Dow Jones industrial average and S&P 500 index added to gains on Wednesday after a stronger-than-expected reading in a gauge of U.S. manufacturing improved the outlook for the economy. The Dow Jones industrial average .DJI was up 77.54 points, or 0.62 percent, at 12,540.69. The Standard & Poor's 500 Index .SPX was up 6.90 points, or 0.49 percent, at 1,425.20. The Nasdaq Composite Index .IXIC was up 24.30 points, or 1.01 percent, at 2,439.59.
story.title: us stocks - dow , s & p extend gains after ism data
